text: This #NationalPublicHealthWeek, the health and well-being of the country has never been more important. Thanks to all who are working to beat #COVID19 now, and keeping our communities healthy year-round. https://t.co/CMfdtAJ7gI

Gotten a lot of questions about #SocialSecurity recipients and the tax rebate check:

YES - Those who qualify will automatically receive the $1200, in addition to their regular benefits.

NO - If you don’t usually file a tax return, you don’t need to now.

Now more than ever, it’s so important to recognize #NationalDoctorsDay and thank all doctors working around the clock to save lives. Thank you for your sacrifices in the fight against #COVID19, and for your commitment to keeping communities healthy across America. https://t.co/Dit8j5I4q1

Glad to see @USDANutrition has now implemented waivers to help #Ohio students access meals while we’re under this public health emergency. This was a provision I supported in the Families First Coronavirus Response Act because we have to ensure kids can access to nutritious food.

JUST NOW ➡️ Great news, the FDA has approved @Battelle to utilize its sterilization systems at full capacity. Now, upwards of 160,000 masks per day can be reused in #Ohio, giving our health care workers the critical PPE they need to fight #COVID19.

Now is not the time for bureaucracy to stand in the way of life-saving innovation. @Battelle must be allowed to utilize their technology to sterilize as much PPE as possible. With @RepBalderson, I’m calling on the FDA to correct this decision immediately. https://t.co/JCDpaG3caF https://t.co/nlMKrM9cvq

It is absolutely crucial, now more than ever, that Congress and the President work together to ensure we deliver solutions to communities nationwide.

This comprehensive package includes free coronavirus testing, food deliveries for seniors, waivers for student’s school lunches, and paid sick and family leave to allow Americans to recover from illness and care for loved ones infected by coronavirus.

Last night, I voted in favor of the Families First Coronavirus Response Act. With the passage of this package, we can expect to see relief for Americans affected by coronavirus. We all share the common goal of keeping our families safe and healthy.
As more information is becoming available online, it’s important to stay aware of falling victim to fraudulent and inaccurate sources. Here are some tips to consider. https://t.co/hzZ6GWkgoM

Thanks to the folks in Central Ohio who are working day-in and day-out to #EndHomelessness. We must take action at all levels to ensure our young people have a place to call home.

No child should ever be without a home, let alone be forced to cut through red tape to access assistance. My bill, the Homeless Children and Youth Act, will help better understand & tackle the growing problem of youth homelessness in #OH15 and nationwide. https://t.co/Hhc44ijdPQ

There's not much Members of Congress agree on, but caring for our veterans is the right thing to do. Yesterday, the House passed the #PAWSforVetsTherapy Act unanimously. Special thanks to @RepKathleenRice for being the lead cosponsor and helping to get it over the finish line. https://t.co/zJmgOOAxSK

JUST IN: The #PAWS4VetsTherapy Act passed the House with unanimous support. I’m proud to fight for policies proven to give veterans a new lease on life. I’ve met with so many brave men and women whose lives have been transformed by working with service dogs - this is for you. https://t.co/92MAzyRlIX

Heading into the #SOTU. I hope the President highlights issues that will bring us together - caring for our veterans, improving our infrastructure, access for rural broadband, and fiscal discipline. https://t.co/t48Z3aOFsO

I’m thrilled to have Mr. Walter Parker, a Vietnam War veteran, and his service dog Jackson, join me for tonight’s #SOTU. We need to pass the #PAWS4VetsTherapyAct to ensure more veterans have access to the benefits of service dogs to treat PTS. https://t.co/WS6CCthr2F

I know firsthand the stress that the cost of college causes. One of the reasons I joined the Ohio Army National Guard was to help pay for OSU. Learn more about the DEBT from Student Loans Act that I introduced to reduce student loan debt and help students: https://t.co/LgDH6KHe7X

Yesterday, we launched the  #FOWCaucus to give workers the skills they need to stay ahead as artificial intelligence begins to impact jobs from manufacturing to financial services.

Every child deserves a safe place to call home, and I’m grateful to have partners at the local, state and federal level fighting to #EndHomelessness. The FY20 spending bill secured $125M for the STOP School Violence Act, a bill I was proud to cosponsor, to create safer environments for students through prevention & mental health efforts. This funding will get critical resources to schools, law enforcement, & health providers.

2019 was memorable, some highlights include:

✅More jobs
✅Passed USMCA
✅Introduced legislation to pair veterans with service dogs

We need to conduct a thorough battle damage assessment, and any response should be considered through the lens of what is in America’s best interest and should not needlessly escalate hostilities.

My heart is with our troops tonight as they stand in defense of America against the missile attack in Iraq.  As a veteran of Operation Iraqi Freedom, I believe that we must be strategic in our choices, but consistent in our support of our brave men and women.

I served overseas to defend our First Amendment rights, including the freedom of religion. Anti-Semitism has no place in our country. To the #Ohio Jewish community, and to all worldwide who are #JewishAndProud - we are with you.

Hezbollah and the Iranian government cannot expect an attack on any American to go unanswered, and as I continue to monitor the situation in Baghdad, I’m grateful to the brave diplomats and servicemembers who are defending democracy against terrorism.
